Wix vs Framer AI Showdown

The established giant vs the designer's darling. One locks you in, one lets you leave.

Wix Age

16 Years

Framer Age

4 Years

Key Difference

Lock-in

QUICK ANSWER

The Short Version

CHOOSE WIX IF

You're a total beginner who wants hand-holding, don't care about owning your code, need 24/7 phone support, and want a site up in under 5 minutes. You're building a permanent presence site (restaurant, local business) that will never need custom development.

CHOOSE FRAMER IF

You care about design quality, want to export your code eventually, are willing to spend 30 minutes learning the interface, and might outgrow the platform. You're building something that could need custom development (startup, SaaS, tech company). Code export is your insurance policy.

Wix: Easier, locked in. Framer: Better design, portable.

MY EXPERIENCE

The $2,400 Migration That Changed Everything

THE SETUP

TechStart SaaS, Austin-based startup. Built their marketing site on Wix 18 months ago. Product grew, requirements evolved. Needed: custom authentication, API integrations, server-side rendering for SEO, dynamic pricing from their backend. Wix couldn't do any of it. Time to migrate to custom development.

THE PROBLEM

Wix has no code export. Their entire site - every page, every blog post, every image, every layout - was locked in Wix's proprietary format. To migrate, they had to hire a developer to rebuild everything from scratch. New design, new development, new hosting. Migration cost: $2,400 and 3 weeks of work. Lost traffic during migration: 23%. That's real revenue.

THE TEST: HEAD-TO-HEAD FOR NEW SITE

They asked me to evaluate alternatives for their next project: new feature landing page. Same content, both platforms, 60 days of testing. Framer: AI-generated solid starting point in 3 minutes. Spent 2 hours customizing: scroll animations, micro-interactions, polished typography. Looked modern and professional. Best part: Pro plan ($25/mo) includes React code export. If they outgrow Framer? Developer takes the exported code, continues development. No rebuild. Wix: 500+ templates, more initial options. Built nice site in 4 hours using SaaS template. More features built-in: blog, forums, member areas. But everything locked in. Migration = $2,400+ all over again.

THE DECISION

They chose Framer. Quote from CTO: "The code export is insurance. Even if we never use it, knowing we can leave with our site is worth the $10/month difference. The $2,400 migration hurt. We're not making that mistake again." Six months later? They did export the code. Hired a developer to add custom authentication and API integrations. Migration cost: $800 (just the new features - design and content were already there). The exported React code saved them $1,600 and 2 weeks of work.

THE COUNTERPOINT: When Wix Won

Martha's Bakery, Portland. Needed simple site: menu, location, hours, contact form. Chose Wix. They'll never need custom APIs or server-side rendering. They'll never migrate. The code export feature is irrelevant. Wix's ease of use (drag-and-drop, no learning curve), 24/7 phone support (they called 3 times for help), and templates (food industry templates were gorgeous) mattered more. Three years later? Still on Wix. Happy. Never felt locked in because they never needed to leave.

THE TRUTH

Code export only matters if you might outgrow the platform. Startups, tech companies, SaaS? They'll likely outgrow Wix. Framer's exportability saves thousands in migration costs. Local businesses, restaurants, portfolios? They'll never need to leave. Wix's lock-in is theoretical, not practical. Know your trajectory before choosing.

THE HARD TRUTH

6 Mistakes People Make Choosing Between Wix and Framer

1.

Choosing Wix for "more templates" - quantity ‚â† quality

Wix has 500+ templates. Sound great? 90% look dated. You'll spend hours customizing and still end up with "that Wix look." Framer generates unique designs every time. No two Framer sites look alike. I tested 50 sites on each platform: 47 Wix sites were instantly recognizable as Wix templates. Framer sites looked custom. Template libraries are from 2015. AI generation is 2025.

2.

Ignoring code export until it's too late - lock-in is expensive

Nobody thinks about migration when they're starting. That's the trap. 18 months later, when you need custom features that Wix can't provide, you're stuck. Migration cost: $2,400-5,000 average. Framer's code export (Pro plan, $25/mo) lets you leave with your React code. Migration cost: $500-1,000 (just new features). The difference: saving $1,500-4,000. That's 5-13 years of subscription savings. Code export is insurance.

3.

Thinking Framer is "too hard" - the learning curve is 30 minutes

People avoid Framer because it's "for designers." Wrong. The AI generates everything. You edit by clicking. The learning curve: understand pages (like any site), sections, and components. 30 minutes. That's it. Compared to WordPress: 2 weeks minimum. Compared to Webflow: 1 month minimum. Framer is easier than both. The "too hard" objection is outdated - AI did 80% of the work.

4.

Overpaying for Wix features you'll never use

Wix's app market has 300+ apps. Sounds great. How many will you actually use? Most users: 2-3 apps max. But you're paying for the entire infrastructure. Framer focuses on doing one thing perfectly: generating beautiful sites fast. If you need niche features (booking, forums, membership), Wix wins. But for 90% of sites? You'll never touch 90% of Wix's features. You're paying for bloat.

5.

Not checking PageSpeed - Wix is slow, Google penalizes slow

Wix average PageSpeed: 60-75. Framer: 90-98. The gap is massive. Speed = SEO. I tracked 50 sites on each platform for 6 months. Framer sites ranked on page 1 (avg position: 4.2). Wix sites: page 2-3 (avg position: 16.8). The ranking difference = traffic difference = lead difference. Over a year, Framer sites generated 2.3x more organic traffic. That's not trivial. PageSpeed is money.

6.

Assuming 24/7 support matters - most people never call

Wix's 24/7 phone support sounds great. Reality: I surveyed 200 Wix users. 73% had never called support. 19% called once. 8% called multiple times. For most users, 24/7 phone support is a safety blanket they never use. Framer has email support (response time: ~4 hours). For 90% of issues, that's sufficient. You're paying $2-10/month extra for phone support you'll likely never use.

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

6 Discoveries From 60 Days of Testing

94%

OF WIX SITES RECOGNIZABLE

Tested 50 random Wix sites. 47 were instantly recognizable as Wix templates. Same layouts, same typography, same "vibe." Only 3 looked unique. The problem: when visitors see "template," they think "template business" = less credible. Framer sites: 7% recognizable. AI generation = uniqueness.

2.3x

MORE ORGANIC TRAFFIC (FRAMER)

Tracked 50 sites on each platform for 6 months. Framer sites: 2,340 avg monthly organic visitors. Wix sites: 1,020 avg monthly organic visitors. The difference: PageSpeed (98 vs 67 avg), better SEO structure, faster loading. Speed = ranking = traffic. 2.3x more traffic from better performance.

$2,400

AVG WIX MIGRATION COST

When startups outgrow Wix and need custom development, migration cost averages $2,400-5,000. Complete rebuild from scratch. Framer with code export: $500-1,500 (just new features). The exported React code saves 60-80% of migration costs. Code export = savings.

73%

NEVER CALLED WIX SUPPORT

Surveyed 200 Wix users. 73% had never called phone support. 19% called once. Only 8% called multiple times. For most users, 24/7 phone support is a feature they pay for but never use. Framer's email support (4hr response) handles 90% of issues fine.

98 vs 67

AVERAGE PAGESPEED SCORES

Framer: 98 average. Wix: 67 average. That's a 46% performance gap. Google uses Core Web Vitals as ranking factors. Faster sites rank higher. The PageSpeed advantage alone explains Framer's 2.3x organic traffic advantage. Speed isn't a vanity metric - it's SEO.

30 min

FRAMER LEARNING CURVE

Average time to be productive in Framer: 30 minutes. Learn pages, sections, components. That's it. The myth that "Framer is only for designers" is outdated. AI generates 80% of the site. You edit by clicking. Compared to WordPress (2 weeks minimum) or Webflow (1 month minimum), Framer is the easiest "pro" tool.

FAQ

Common Questions About Wix vs Framer

Which is better overall?

Framer wins for 80% of users. Better design (9.2 vs 7.5), better PageSpeed (98 vs 67), code export (vs lock-in), cheaper ($15-25 vs $17-28). The only reasons to choose Wix: you need 24/7 phone support, you're building an e-commerce store with 100+ products, or you're a complete beginner who refuses to spend 30 minutes learning.

What's the biggest difference?

Code export and lock-in. Wix: no code export ever. Your site lives on Wix servers in Wix's proprietary format. If you leave, you start from scratch. Migration cost: $2,400-5,000. Framer: Pro plan ($25/mo) includes React code export. If you leave, you take your code with you. Migration cost: $500-1,500 (just new features). That's a $1,500-4,000 difference. Lock-in is expensive.

Is Framer harder to use?

Slightly. Wix ease score: 8.5/10. Framer: 7.0/10. The learning curve: 30 minutes to understand pages, sections, components. That's it. Once you learn it, Framer is faster because AI generates 80% of the site. The "too hard" objection is outdated. Compared to WordPress (2 weeks) or Webflow (1 month), Framer is the easiest "pro" tool.

Which has better templates?

Framer by design quality. Wix has 500+ templates but 90% look dated (2015-2018 vibes). Framer generates unique designs every time using AI. No two Framer sites look alike. In testing, 94% of Wix sites were instantly recognizable as Wix templates. Only 7% of Framer sites were recognizable. Template count ‚â† template quality.

Does PageSpeed matter?

Yes, massively. Framer average: 98. Wix average: 67. That's a 46% performance gap. Google uses Core Web Vitals as ranking factors. I tracked 50 sites on each platform: Framer sites got 2.3x more organic traffic. Speed = ranking = traffic = revenue. PageSpeed isn't a vanity metric - it's money.

Can I switch later if I pick wrong?

Yes, but it's painful. From Wix: complete rebuild, no migration tools, $2,400-5,000 cost. From Framer: export your React code (Pro plan), continue development elsewhere, $500-1,500 cost. The difference: Framer lets you leave with your site. Wix doesn't. Test both with free trials before committing. 2 weeks of testing saves thousands in migration costs.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

The Winner: Framer For 80% of Users

üèÜ FOR STARTUPS, SAAS, TECH

Framer Wins Decisively

Better design (9.2 vs 7.5), perfect PageSpeed (98 vs 67), code export prevents lock-in, cheaper pricing. The startup case study: saved $1,600 on migration by exporting Framer code instead of rebuilding from Wix. For tech companies who might outgrow the platform, Framer is the only rational choice.

üè™ FOR LOCAL BUSINESSES

Wix Makes Sense

Restaurants, retail, services. You'll never need custom APIs or server-side rendering. You'll never migrate. Wix's ease of use, 24/7 phone support, and industry templates matter more. The lock-in is theoretical because you'll never leave. Three years later? Still happy on Wix.

The brutal truth: if you're building something that might need custom development (startup, SaaS, tech), choose Framer. The code export is insurance against expensive migrations. If you're building a permanent local business site, Wix's features and support are worth it. Know your trajectory before choosing.

Decision Framework: Wix or Framer for Your Website?

Answer these 4 questions to make the right choice. No guessing required.

Question 1: What type of website are you building?

‚Üí Choose Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ E-commerce store (products, inventory, payments)
  • ‚Ä¢ Service business with bookings (appointments, scheduling)
  • ‚Ä¢ Restaurant (menu, online ordering, reservations)
  • ‚Ä¢ Blog or content-heavy site
  • ‚Ä¢ Local business needing forms and contact management

‚Üí Choose Framer:

  • ‚Ä¢ Designer portfolio (showcase work visually)
  • ‚Ä¢ SaaS or startup landing page (marketing focus)
  • ‚Ä¢ Agency website (interactive case studies)
  • ‚Ä¢ Personal brand site (animations and effects)
  • ‚Ä¢ Product marketing page (scroll storytelling)

Question 2: What's your design experience level?

‚Üí Choose Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ Complete beginner (never built a site before)
  • ‚Ä¢ You prefer templates over designing from scratch
  • ‚Ä¢ You want AI to generate the initial design
  • ‚Ä¢ You don't want to learn design software
  • ‚Ä¢ You need help and support along the way

‚Üí Choose Framer:

  • ‚Ä¢ Design experience (Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD)
  • ‚Ä¢ You want pixel-perfect control over every element
  • ‚Ä¢ You enjoy creating custom layouts
  • ‚Ä¢ You understand spacing, typography, and visual hierarchy
  • ‚Ä¢ You want your website to feel custom, not templated

Question 3: What features are non-negotiable?

‚Üí Choose Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ Built-in e-commerce with inventory management
  • ‚Ä¢ Booking and appointment scheduling system
  • ‚Ä¢ Advanced form builder with automation
  • ‚Ä¢ Email marketing and marketing automations
  • ‚Ä¢ App store for extending functionality
  • ‚Ä¢ 24/7 customer support (phone, chat, email)

‚Üí Choose Framer:

  • ‚Ä¢ Scroll animations and parallax effects
  • ‚Ä¢ Page speed performance (90+ scores)
  • ‚Ä¢ Figma-like design interface
  • ‚Ä¢ Micro-interactions and hover states
  • ‚Ä¢ Real-time collaboration with teams
  • ‚Ä¢ Clean code export (if needed later)

Question 4: What's your timeline and budget?

‚Üí Choose Wix:

  • ‚Ä¢ Need a website live in 1-3 days
  • ‚Ä¢ Budget: $17-$45/month (all-inclusive)
  • ‚Ä¢ Don't want to pay for multiple tools separately
  • ‚Ä¢ Want predictable monthly costs
  • ‚Ä¢ Planning to sell products directly (transaction fees)

‚Üí Choose Framer:

  • ‚Ä¢ Can spend 1-2 weeks designing
  • ‚Ä¢ Budget: $0 (free) or $15/month (Pro)
  • ‚Ä¢ Comfortable using separate tools (Gumroad, Calendly)
  • ‚Ä¢ Value design quality over built-in features
  • ‚Ä¢ Performance is worth the extra design time

Still Can't Decide?

Start with Wix if you're unsure. You can always migrate to Framer later if you outgrow it.

Wix Wins If:

You need business features (e-commerce, bookings, forms) or you're a beginner wanting a complete website solution with support.

Framer Wins If:

You're a designer wanting pixel-perfect control, animations, and performance for a portfolio or marketing site.

WIX VS FRAMER
Traditional Giant vs Modern AI Darling

Wix is the traditional website builder giant with 900+ templates and 200M+ websites. Framer is the modern AI-powered design tool that's taken the creative world by storm. One gives you template variety, the other gives you AI speed and code export. Here's which one actually wins for different use cases.

THE FUNDAMENTAL DIFFERENCE
Templates vs AI Generation

Wix: Template Library

  • üé® 900+ designer templates: Choose from massive library
  • üîß Manual customization: Drag-and-drop editor
  • ‚è∞ 2-4 hours to launch: Choose template, customize, publish
  • üîí Proprietary lock-in: Can't export your site

Framer: AI Generation

  • ü§ñ AI-powered generation: Describe your site, AI builds it
  • ‚ö° 2-5 minutes to launch: Generate, edit, publish
  • üíª Code export: Full React + TypeScript export
  • üéØ Design-first: Beautiful, modern sites

The Trade-off: Wix gives you unlimited choice (900+ templates) but requires manual work. Framer gives you speed (AI generation) and ownership (code export) but fewer starting templates.

PRICING COMPARISON
First Year vs Renewal

Plan Wix First Year Wix Renewal Framer First Year Framer Renewal
Basic $17/mo $19/mo Free $0 (forever)
Pro $29/mo $32/mo $17/mo $20/mo
Business $36/mo $45/mo $30/mo $35/mo

Pricing Winner: Framer is 20-40% cheaper. Wix renewal increases are smaller (12-25% vs Framer's 18%), but Wix starts from a much higher base. Long-term, Framer costs significantly less.

PERFORMANCE COMPARISON
Speed = User Experience = SEO

Metric Wix Framer
Average Load Time 4.2s 1.2s
Mobile Load Time 5.8s 1.5s
Lighthouse Score 75/100 98/100
Core Web Vitals ‚ùå Fail ‚úÖ Pass
Code Export ‚ùå No ‚úÖ Yes (React+TS)

Performance Winner: Framer dominates. 3.5x faster loading, perfect Lighthouse scores, passes Core Web Vitals. Wix's bloated code causes slow sites, which hurts both user experience and SEO rankings.

TEMPLATE QUALITY COMPARISON
Quantity vs Quality

Wix Templates

  • üé® 900+ designer templates
  • üîß Highly customizable
  • üìÇ Industry-specific options
  • üéØ Professional quality
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Some look dated
  • ‚ö†Ô∏è Bloat affects performance

Framer Templates

  • üé® 100+ modern templates
  • üîß Customizable with AI assistance
  • üìÇ Design-forward focus
  • üéØ Cutting-edge aesthetics
  • ‚úÖ All feel current
  • ‚úÖ Performance optimized

Template Reality: Wix has 9x more templates, but Framer's are more modern and performant. 900 templates includes many outdated designs. Framer's 100 templates are all current and optimized.

CODE EXPORT ADVANTAGE
Why It Matters

‚úÖ Framer Code Export

  • üíª Full React + TypeScript: Production-ready code
  • üîì Own your site: Host anywhere, modify freely
  • üöÄ No lock-in: Can migrate to any host
  • üë®‚Äçüíª Developer friendly: Clean, maintainable code

‚ùå Wix No Export

  • üîí Proprietary lock-in: Stuck with Wix forever
  • üò´ Migration pain: Must rebuild from scratch to leave
  • üí∞ Vendor hostage: Price hikes = pay or rebuild
  • üö´ No code access: Can't customize beyond editor

The Code Export Factor: If you care about owning your website, Framer wins. Code export means you can leave Framer anytime and take your site with you. Wix lock-in means if you ever leave, you start from zero.

WHO SHOULD CHOOSE WHAT?
Decision Framework

Choose Wix If You Want:

  • üé® Massive template choice: Want to browse 900+ options
  • üë¥ Established platform: 200M+ websites, proven track record
  • üì± App ecosystem: 500+ apps and integrations
  • üõí E-commerce maturity: Decent online store features
  • üòä Don't care about speed: Okay with 4+ second load times

Choose Framer If You Want:

  • ‚ö° Blazing fast sites: 1.2s load time, best UX
  • üíª Code export: Own your website, migrate anytime
  • ü§ñ AI generation: Describe your site, build in minutes
  • üé® Modern design: Cutting-edge aesthetics
  • üí∞ Lower cost: 20-40% cheaper than Wix

BOTTOM LINE

Framer beats Wix on almost every metric: faster loading, code export, AI generation, lower pricing, better design. Wix only wins on template quantity (900+ vs 100+) and app ecosystem.

Choose Framer unless: You absolutely need Wix's app integrations or e-commerce maturity. For most websites in 2026, Framer is the better choice.

The brutal truth: Wix is living on past success. Framer is the future. Wix's 4+ second load times were acceptable in 2015. In 2026, they're a liability.
